intro: Phippsiomeles mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican starfruit tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright orange, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a suitable candidate for cultivation in arid and semi-arid climates. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is sometimes grown in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
